properties.abstract: The approach to Bordierh체tte from Gasenried takes you through an incredibly picturesque landscape. Once you leave the larch forest, the valley opens up and the effects of global warming, evident through signs of rapid glacial retreat, becomes immediately apparent. The path leading on from Alpija over the west lateral moraine gives an idea of how powerful the Ried Glacier used to be. A white-blue-white marked footpath follows the moraine until it merges into scree, then crosses the disintegrating toe of the Ried glacier at a flat section, before leading steeply but safely up to the hut.
properties.title: From Gasenried via Alpja

sac_photos.title: Soon the path leaves the moraine crest and moves into screes and talus on the right.
View down valley from the crest of the moraine.
The glacier forefield of the rapidly retreating Ried Glacier.
The Bordierh체tte of SAC Section Geneva.

segments.description: From Gasenried (1659 m, PostBus), follow the road or the path just above towards Schalbettu (1683 m). Stay low and continue along the Europaweg (Gr채chen - Zermatt) over the Riedbach (bridge ca. 1671 m). Make a sharp left directly after and head up through damp forest first to P. 1739 (crossroads), then left again and up to P. 1998, where the Europaweg branches off to the right (west). Continues S straight up into a small valley, trapped between the steep mountain slope on the right and the lateral moraine on your left. You can also reach here via the hiking trails on the eastern side of the valley (roughly the same time). From Alpja (2099 m) continue up the shallow valley beside the west lateral moraine. At around 2400 m the new hut trail begins, which first leads horizontally eastwards into the valley, crosses the glacier stream and on the opposite slope via Trift finally reaches the hut from the north.
segments.title: Gasenried - Schalbettu - Riedbach - Alpja

segments.description: Old white-blue-white marked trail, attention, no longer maintained! At approximately 2400 m, you'll join to the moraine ridge, which offers an unobstructed view of the imposing rock step and waterfall left exposed by the retreating Ried glacier. Continue along (or in the hollow next to) the moraine until it merges into screes. Continue diagonally southwards. Shortly before a rock band the path zig-zags more steeply up to the right before levelling out and leading over to P. 2706. From here ascend to around 2740 m, until you gain access to the flat, crevasse-free section of the glacier (as of 2019). Reach the far (N) bank at approx. 2750 m, then follow way up to the hut.

photos.caption: The old path still follows the moraine ridge, further up it leads to the right through the boulder field and to the left over the glacier.

segments.title: Old blue-white marked path
